Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.1: Woe to the provoking, and redeemed city, the dove.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.2: She hath not hearkened to the voice, neither hath she received discipline: she hath not trusted in the Lord, she drew not near to her God.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.3: Her princes are in the midst of her as roaring lions: her judges are evening wolves, they left nothing for the morning.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.4: Her prophets are senseless men without faith: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have acted unjustly against the law.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.5: The just Lord is in the midst thereof, he will not do iniquity: in the morning, in the morning he will bring his judgment to light, and it shall not be hid: but the wicked man hath not known shame.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.6: I have destroyed the nations, and their towers are beaten down: I have made their ways desert, so that there is none that passeth by: their cities are desolate, there is not a man remaining, nor any inhabitant.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.7: I said: Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive correction: and her dwelling shall not perish, for all things wherein I have visited her: but they rose early and corrupted all their thoughts.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.8: Wherefore expect me, saith the Lord, in the day of my resurrection that is to come, for my judgment is to assemble the Gentiles, and to gather the kingdoms: and to pour upon them my indignation, all my fierce anger: for with the fire of my jealousy shall all the earth be devoured.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.9: Because then I will restore to the people a chosen lip, that all may call upon the name of the Lord, and may serve him with one shoulder.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.10: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia, shall my suppliants the children of my dispersed people bring me an offering.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.11: In that day thou shalt not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee thy proud boasters, and thou shalt no more be lifted up because of my holy mountain.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.12: And I will leave in the midst of thee a poor and needy people: and they shall hope in the name of the Lord.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.13: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies, nor shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed, and shall lie down, and there shall be none to make them afraid.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.14: Give praise, O daughter of Sion: shout, O Israel: be glad, and rejoice with all thy heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.15: The Lord hath taken away thy judgment, he hath turned away thy enemies: the king of Israel the Lord is in the midst of thee, thou shalt fear evil no more.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.16: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem: Fear not: to Sion: Let not thy hands be weakened.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.17: The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty, he will save: he will rejoice over thee with gladness, he will be silent in his love, he will be joyful over thee in praise.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.18: The triflers that were departed from the law, I will gather together, because they were of thee: that thou mayest no more suffer reproach for them.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.19: Behold I will cut off all that have afflicted thee at that time: and I will save her that halteth, and will gather her that was cast out: and I will get them praise, and a name, in all the land where they had been put to confusion.
Zephaniah or Sophonias__03.20: At that time, when I will bring you: and at the time that I will gather you: for I will give you a name, and praise among all the people of the earth, when I shall have brought back your captivity before your eyes, saith the Lord.
